org.tigr.antware.shared.util
Class Logger

java.lang.Object
  org.tigr.antware.shared.util.Logger

public class Logger
extends Object

The class Logger extends the log4j logging by adding two additional log levels to the logging API. In addition this class provides methods to configure logging using the old style flags.

To use this class a new instance must be created using the constructor. Typically a static instance is created for each class and is used throughout the class.

Even thoug this class replaces the default log4j class, the startup behavior is the same. When a logger is created for the first time in the instance of the JRE it checks to see if the logging classes were configured, if not the LogManager first attempts to see if the user has specified a logging configuration file through the VM property setting log4j.configuration and configuring the system using that file. This is the preferred way of initializing the logging system. See the sample below: 

java -Dlog4j.configuration=file:/home/amahurka/alt_log4j.xml

If this property has not been specified, then the system searches for the files log4j.xml, or log4j.properties, in the classpath (the file can be included in a jar that is in the classpath) and configures the system using one of these files.

For backward compatibility of ANTWare logging, the logging system may also be configured using one of the initializeLogging methods. We suggest that you use one of the log4j initialization procedures for greater flexibility. Created on Oct 29, 2003

Written:

initializeLogging

public static void initializeLogging(String logFile,
                                     int logLevel)
The method initializeLogging initializes the logging using log4j style loggers. If a log file and/or level is specified a default appender is created and added to the root logger. If a log file is specified a file appender is created, otherwise a console appender is created.

Parameters:
p_logFile - a String value representing the log file name, if null the appender is a console appender
p_logLevel - a int value representing the log level, if it is set to zero then the default log level is used.

initializeLogging

public static void initializeLogging()
The method initializeLogging initializes the loggers using a logging configuration file. First the system checks to see if the user has specified the log4j.configuration property in which case the value is used as the name of the configuration file to use for configuring the logging system. If the file ends with an 'xml' extension then the XMLConfigurator is used, otherwise the file is assumed to be a java style properties file.

If not configuration file is specified then the system configures the logging system using log4j's default initialization which involves searching for log4j.xml or log4j.properties file either in the current working directory or somewhere in the classpath.

The default beavior is for the system to monitor for changes to the configuration file at the user specified frequency, the default being every minute. The user can modify this by specifying runtime property log4j.watch.frequency with the watch frequency in seconds. If the use wants to disable watching, the user can use the runtime property log4j.watch as either true or false.

If the user specifies that the configuration file should be watched, then the logging system is configured to check the configuration file at the specified frequency to check for changes and the logging system is reconfigured.
